intro: Brickellia glabrata, commonly known as silverleaf brickellia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage, which gives it its common name, and its clusters of small, yellow-orange flowers. The plant is typically found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. Brickellia glabrata is also valued for its drought tolerance and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
